alert.note: Alert for Valley (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 30 at 9:17AM MDT by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 AM MDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Montana, including the following county, Valley. * WHEN...Until 915 AM MDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 916 AM MDT, satellite estimates indicate heavy rain from thunderstorms in the advisory area. This will cause small stream flooding. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Southwestern Valley County - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
